Speaker: TV
Dialogue: The dirigible 'Spirit of Freedom' that landed in this town due to the heavy rainstorm has finished its repairs and will continue its journey to the South Pole. We plan to broadcast the departure live from the seaside park.

Speaker: OSONO
Dialogue: Yes this is the Gutiokipanja bakery. Oh Kiki. Yes. But you should take more time...Oh yes. The lady you met the other day wants you to stop over again. What do you want to do? Shall I turn her down? I told her you were on vacation for awhile but she insists...Really? Then stop in on your way back. Bye.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Good day.

Speaker: BERTHA
Dialogue: Well well come in. We've been waiting eagerly.

Speaker: TV
Dialogue: It's almost 5 minutes until departure. The city's 'Seahorse Band' is playing and the crew is waving to the crowd below. The group of people holding the rope are eagerly awaiting the departure signal. The final check seems almost complete...

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Here I am Madam.

Speaker: MADAM
Dialogue: Welcome. Please excuse me for not getting up. The weather's nice but my legs are bothering me. Bertha would you bring it?

Speaker: BERTHA
Dialogue: Yes yes. Madam has it taken off yet?

Speaker: MADAM
Dialogue: Not yet. Isn't it funny? She's crazy about dirigibles.

Speaker: BERTHA
Dialogue: It's the adventure that I like.

Speaker: MADAM
Dialogue: Would you turn the sound down a bit? Kiki would you open this box?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: All right. Madam this...

Speaker: MADAM
Dialogue: I'd like that delivered to a person named Kiki because she did a big favor for me the other day. It's my way of saying 'Thank you'. I'd also be happy if at the same time you would find out her birthday. Then I can bake another cake... Kiki...

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: I'm very sure that person will want to know Madam's birthday too. It would be fun thinking of a present.

Speaker: MADAM
Dialogue: That's true isn't it.

Speaker: TV
Dialogue: It's a gust of wind. A gale...Oh!

Speaker: MADAM
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: BERTHA
Dialogue: It seems like there was an accident.

Speaker: TV
Dialogue: It's serious trouble! The rope has broken!! The dirigible is being blown away. Ah it's coming towards our broadcast truck! Oh no!!

Speaker: BERTHA
Dialogue: Ah at the most important moment...what are they showing!?

Speaker: MADAM
Dialogue: These strong winds sometimes come up in the summer. It will come by here in a minute.

Speaker: BERTHA
Dialogue: Madam! The picture's back. It's upside down!!

Speaker: TV
Dialogue: We're here at the seaside park...Blown by a sudden gust of wind the 'Spirit of Freedom' is almost touching ground...

Speaker: BERTHA
Dialogue: When you come right down to it it's just a balloon.

Speaker: TV
Dialogue: It's lost its balance and the ship is now upside down. They're doing their best to anchor the last rope holding the dirigible. I wonder if they can hold the ship; it looks like it's ready to float away. Ahh it's no good...

Speaker: The
Dialogue: tremendous lift of the helium gas is pulling the dirigible higher and higher. The powerful force of the helium matched against several hundred people...

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Tombo!! That boy's a friend of mine!

Speaker: TV
Dialogue: It's throwing off people one by one and floating higher and higher. Ah even a patrol car is being carried away like a toy. What's going to happen...?!

Speaker: A
Dialogue: young boy is being carried away with a patrol car! This is terrible! Who would have thought something like this would happen?!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Tombo!

Speaker: MADAM
Dialogue: You say he's a friend of yours?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: I have to go.

Speaker: MADAM
Dialogue: Be careful!

Speaker: BERTHA
Dialogue: How terrible!

Speaker: CAPTAIN
Dialogue: Hold on! Don't let go! Release helium from the rear compartments! Hurry!!

Speaker: RADIO
Dialogue: The helium in the dirigible will not explode. Townspeople don't panic and move about calmly.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: How's Tombo?...Is the boy all right?!

Speaker: MAN
Dialogue: IN CAR: I don't know but they said the patrol car fell.

Speaker: FIRETRUCK
Dialogue: Move aside! Open up the street! Clear the way!

Speaker: STREET
Dialogue: SWEEPER: Are you OK?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Mister please lend me that broom!

Speaker: STREET
Dialogue: SWEEPER: Huh?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Please! I promise to return it!

Speaker: STREET
Dialogue: SWEEPER: Well I guess...

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Thank you!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Fly!!

Speaker: BYSTANDER
Dialogue: She's flying...!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Fly straight or I'll throw you in the fire!

Speaker: ANNOUNCER
Dialogue: Nothing has happened to the boy yet but the 'Spirit of Freedom' is being blown by the wind and is approaching the city tower. If it continues it'll crash into the tower...

Speaker: TOMBO
Dialogue: We're going to hit! More altitude!

Speaker: CAPTAIN
Dialogue: We don't have enough gas! Before we crash jump into the tower!

Speaker: TOMBO
Dialogue: I'll try!

Speaker: CARETAKER
Dialogue: Hey! Come over here!

Speaker: TOMBO
Dialogue: Mister! Get away!

Speaker: CARETAKER
Dialogue: Grab this!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Fly faster! Hey!!

Speaker: ANNOUNCER
Dialogue: Listen to that! It's the tremendous noise of the gas escaping. We can't see from here what happened to the young lad.

Speaker: It's
Dialogue: going to fall! The gas is escaping! The dirigible is going to fall!! It's caught! It stopped! It's been stopped! Look the lad is still there! It's a miracle! The lad is still hanging there! But then how are they going to save him? If they don't do something that brave lad...

Speaker: ANNOUNCER
Dialogue: What what was that?! A bird...No it's a young girl! A young girl is flying through the air!! It's a witch! It's not a broom! It's a witch riding on a push broom!!

Speaker: MADAM
Dialogue: It's Kiki!

Speaker: BERTHA
Dialogue: Go!

Speaker: OSONO
Dialogue: That child she's flying!

Speaker: KETTO
Dialogue: Go get him!!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: TOMBO!!

Speaker: TOMBO
Dialogue: KIKI!!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Listen you're a good boy so do as I tell you!

Speaker: CAPTAIN
Dialogue: Keep trying! Just a bit more!!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: TOMBO!!

Speaker: TOMBO
Dialogue: KIKI!!

Speaker: ANNOUNCER
Dialogue: You can do it! Just a bit more!

Speaker: CROWD
Dialogue: Go get him! Go get him! Go get him!!

Speaker: CAPTAIN
Dialogue: You can do it!

Speaker: ANNOUNCER
Dialogue: She caught him!! She caught him in mid-air!!

Speaker: They've
Dialogue: just touched down! It's an emotional scene! It looks like the crew of the dirigible is safe too!

Speaker: STREET-
Dialogue: SWEEPER: I lent her that push-broom you know!

Speaker: MADAM
Dialogue: Ahh!...Stop it Bertha!

Speaker: BERTHA
Dialogue: She did it she did

Speaker: OSONO
Dialogue: Good girl Kiki! Good for you!

Dialogue: Call the doctor! I think it's time!

Dialogue: Mother!! It's a letter from Kiki!
